results.title: Efficacy and Safety of Bacillus coagulans LBSC in Drug Induced Constipation Associated With Functional Gastrointestinal Disorder: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Interventional, Parallel, Controlled Trial a Clinical Study on Bacillus coagulans LBSC for Drug Induced Constipation Associated With FGIDs.
results.text_hl: Methods: A prospective, interventional, randomized, double-blind, parallel, multi-arm, controlled trial with 168 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ experiencing drug induced @DISEASE_Constipation @DISEASE_MESH:D003248 @@@constipation@@@ associated with @<m>DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@FGID symptoms@@@ (@DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@DICAWFGID@@@) screened through Rome IV criteria were randomized into 2 arms, i.e. placebo arm (n = 28) and @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Amitriptyline @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000639 @@@amitriptyline@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002118 @@@calcium@@@ in test arm (n = 28/arm).

citations.NLM: Rathi A, Pagare R. Efficacy and Safety of Bacillus coagulans LBSC in Drug Induced Constipation Associated With Functional Gastrointestinal Disorder: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Interventional, Parallel, Controlled Trial a Clinical Study on Bacillus coagulans LBSC for Drug Induced Constipation Associated With FGIDs. Glob Adv Integr Med Health. 2024 Jan-Dec;13():27536130241286511. PMID: 39295947

results.title: Impact of feed counterion addition and cyclone type on aerodynamic behavior of alginic-atenolol microparticles produced by spray drying.
results.text_hl: Further advantages in terms of stability, dose and @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ preference have often lead researchers to focus on dry powder inhaler delivery systems. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ is an antihypertensive drug with low oral bioavailability and @<m>DISEASE_Gastrointestinal_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D005767 @@@gastrointestinal side@@@ effects.

citations.NLM: Ceschan NE, Bucalá V, Ramírez-Rigo MV, Smyth HD. Impact of feed counterion addition and cyclone type on aerodynamic behavior of alginic-atenolol microparticles produced by spray drying. Eur J Pharm Biopharm. 2016 Dec;109():72-80. PMID: 27697595

results.title: The traditional herbal medicine, Ge-Gen-Tang, inhibits pacemaker potentials by nitric oxide/cGMP dependent ATP-sensitive K(+) channels in cultured interstitial cells of Cajal from mouse small intestine.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Prazosin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011224 @@@Prazosin@@@ (alpha1-adrenoceptor antagonist) and @CHEMICAL_Butoxamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002078 @@@butoxamine@@@ (@GENE_ADRB2 @GENE_11555 @@@beta2-adrenoceptor@@@ antagonist) did not block the GGT-induced effects, whereas @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (@GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_11554 @@@beta1-adrenoceptor@@@ antagonist) blocked the GGT-induced effects.

citations.NLM: Lee S, Gim H, Shim JH, Jung Kim H, Lee JR, Kim SC, Kwon YK, Ha KT, So I, Kim BJ. The traditional herbal medicine, Ge-Gen-Tang, inhibits pacemaker potentials by nitric oxide/cGMP dependent ATP-sensitive K(+) channels in cultured interstitial cells of Cajal from mouse small intestine.
